headline.main: Vegas Tourism Agency May Buy Riviera for Up to $191 Million
headline.print_headline: Vegas Tourism Agency May Buy Riviera for Up to $191 Million

docs.snippet: The aging Riviera hotel and casino on the Las Vegas Strip won't be long for this world if a plan from the Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority to buy, demolish it and make way for a growing convention center gets the go-ahead Friday morning...
docs.lead_paragraph: The aging Riviera hotel and casino on the Las Vegas Strip won't be long for this world if a plan from the Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority to buy, demolish it and make way for a growing convention center gets the go-ahead Friday morning.

headline.main: Proposal Would Add Tolls on NYC's Free Bridges, 60th Street
headline.print_headline: Proposal Would Add Tolls on NYC's Free Bridges, 60th Street

docs.snippet: Reviving a congestion-pricing idea that has been rejected before, an influential transportation coalition proposed implementing tolls for all cars that cross 60th Street in Manhattan and the free bridges spanning the East River....
docs.lead_paragraph: Reviving a congestion-pricing idea that has been rejected before, an influential transportation coalition proposed implementing tolls for all cars that cross 60th Street in Manhattan and the free bridges spanning the East River.

headline.main: Even With Shift, NYC St. Patrick's Day Parade Draws Gay Protests
headline.print_headline: Even With Shift, NYC St. Patrick's Day Parade Draws Gay Protests

docs.snippet: Gay rights activists and elected officials said on Tuesday they would continue to protest New York City's main St. Patrick's Day parade even as organizers prepared to let a gay group carry a banner this year for the first time in the parade's hist...
docs.lead_paragraph: Gay rights activists and elected officials said on Tuesday they would continue to protest New York City's main St. Patrick's Day parade even as organizers prepared to let a gay group carry a banner this year for the first time in the parade's history.

headline.main: Kyle Larson Ready to Become NASCAR's New Superstar
headline.print_headline: Kyle Larson Ready to Become NASCAR's New Superstar

docs.snippet: As Jeff Gordon winds down his long career, the kid who grew up idolizing him is just getting started....

headline.main: Florida School Says 'God Bless America' Not a Constitutional Violation
headline.print_headline: Florida School Says 'God Bless America' Not a Constitutional Violation

docs.snippet: A Florida high school that last week told a student to stop adding the phrase "God bless America" when reading scripted morning announcements, announced on Tuesday his use of the phrase does not violate the U.S. Constitution....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Florida high school that last week told a student to stop adding the phrase "God bless America" when reading scripted morning announcements, announced on Tuesday his use of the phrase does not violate the U.S. Constitution.

headline.main: Japan Post Agrees $5.1 Billion Takeover of Australia's Toll Holdings
headline.print_headline: Japan Post Agrees $5.1 Billion Takeover of Australia's Toll Holdings

docs.snippet: Financial giant Japan Post Holdings Co Ltd launched its global expansion strategy with its largest ever deal on Wednesday, agreeing a A$6.5 billion ($5.1 billion) takeover of Australian freight and logistics firm Toll Holdings Ltd....
docs.lead_paragraph: Financial giant Japan Post Holdings Co Ltd launched its global expansion strategy with its largest ever deal on Wednesday, agreeing a A$6.5 billion ($5.1 billion) takeover of Australian freight and logistics firm Toll Holdings Ltd.

headline.main: Trial of Pakistani al Qaeda suspect begins
headline.sub: Trial of Pakistani al Qaeda suspect begins

docs.snippet: During opening arguments in federal court, a U.S. prosecutor says Abid Naseer's plan to bomb a shopping center in England in 2009 was described in a "chilling" letter to Osama bin Laden. Jillian Kitchener reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: During opening arguments in federal court, a U.S. prosecutor says Abid Naseer's plan to bomb a shopping center in England in 2009 was described in a "chilling" letter to Osama bin Laden. Jillian Kitchener reports.

headline.main: Flexible Work: Nice, if You Can Get It

docs.snippet: Flexible work arrangements have helped Op-Talk readers care for their families and themselves. But some say their schedules have no flexibility at all....
docs.abstract: Flexible work arrangements have helped Op-Talk readers care for their families and themselves. But some say their schedules have no flexibility at all.

headline.main: Man Freed From Prison Sues Northwestern, Says He Was Framed
headline.print_headline: Man Freed From Prison Sues Northwestern, Says He Was Framed

docs.snippet: A Chicago man whose confession helped free a death row inmate in a case that was instrumental to ending capital punishment in Illinois before he recanted filed a $40 million lawsuit Tuesday against Northwestern University and a professor he allege...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Chicago man whose confession helped free a death row inmate in a case that was instrumental to ending capital punishment in Illinois before he recanted filed a $40 million lawsuit Tuesday against Northwestern University and a professor he alleges conspired to frame him.
